comment.author: 77199904@N00
comment._content: I'm not sure of the date on this photograph. According to the Commission de toponymie, Margaret Street (later rue Ste-Marguerite) was renamed Sainte-Cécile in 1907, around the time when Saint-Henri was merged with Montreal, given that Saint-Henri already had a rue Sainte-Marguerite. This photo looks like it was taken with the photographer standing just north of Saint-Antoine Street. All of this area today lies within the footprint of the 1000 De La Gauchetière office tower. There is a small stub of rue Sainte-Cécile left between Saint-Jacques and Saint-Antoine Streets.
